item.title: Nose-ring post-islamic
item.description: Source: TW The Nose-Ring or Nath is an Import from Muslim Invaders A deep-dive into the exciting and chequered history of the Nath or nose-ring, the familiar ornament worn by Hindu women over the centuries. The Nose-Ring or Nath is an Import from Muslim Invaders ABOUT A CENTURY AGO, a health officer named Kershaw Dinshaw Khambata at the Poona Municipality issued a strongly-worded press note. He advised Hindu women against wearing the Nath or nose-ornament because “this custom tends to keep the nose unclean and the ornament becomes a nuisance to the health of the wearer.
